newsitem.title: CANADA: Forzani sees no improvement this year.
newsitem.headline: Forzani sees no improvement this year.

text.p: Sporting goods retailer Forzani Group Ltd was unlikely to show much improvement this fiscal year from last year's loss after reporting deep third-quarter losses on Thursday, chief financial officer Hammie Hill said.

"I think it would be very difficult for us to improve our performance over the prior year at the year end," Hill told Reuters in a phone interview "I think where we will see an improvement is in the fourth quarter alone."
Forzani lost C$0.66 a share in the previous fiscal year ended January 28. Its third-quarter losses rose to C$0.99 a share from year earlier C$0.36. The quarter ended October 27.
Forzani shares dropped 0.75 to a year low of 1.75 in light trading on the Toronto Stock Exchange.
But November sales increased from the previous few months, demonstrating that the holiday sales season would be better than last year's dismal performance, Hill said.
"Considering last year was bad, we don't expect a great Christmas, although (we see) a bit of improvement," Hill added.
Forzani's third quarter was hit by the cost of clearing excess inventory after poor sales during an unseasonably cold spring and summer.
But gross margins were more robust than a year earlier, since stores now carried less inventory, Hill said.
